Class LevenshteinDistance

  • java.lang.Object
    • LevenshteinDistance
  • public class LevenshteinDistance
extends java.lang.Object
    LevenshteinDistance is a class that calculates the edit distance between two words using the Levenshtein algorithm. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levenshtein_distance

    • Field Summary

      private char[] firstWordArray  
      private int[][] matrix  
      private int minimumDistance  
      private java.lang.String secondWord  
      private char[] secondWordArray

      Fills the matrix by by checking if the values in the [i-1] and [j-1] position are the same.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevenshteinDistance

        public LevenshteinDistance​(java.lang.String firstWord,
                           java.lang.String secondWord)
        Constructs a LevenshteinDistance. Initilizes matrix with numbers counting from 0-length for first column and first row.
        Parameters:
        firstWord - String word to convert from
        secondWord - String word to convert to

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method for LevensheteinDistance
        Parameters:
        args - System inputs

      • fillMatrix

        public void fillMatrix()
        Fills the matrix by by checking if the values in the [i-1] and [j-1] position are the same. If they are the same then convert the current to that. Otherwise find the min and convert current spot to the min +1 of the three

      • min

        private int min​(int i,
                int j)
        Calculates the min of the left, up, and top left positions.
        Parameters:
        i - int: Current i position
        j - int: Current j position
        Returns:
        int: min of three positions

      • backTrack

        public void backTrack()
        Tracks back through all the position changes to print out what was changed. Each direction change corresponds to a replace/add/remove.

      • backTrackMin

        public java.lang.String backTrackMin​(int i,
                                     int j)
        Calcualates what position the current value was calculated from
        Parameters:
        i - int: Current i position
        j - int Current j position
        Returns:
        String: corresponds to what position

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts the matrix and words to a map to easy see the process in the terminal
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String of matrix with words
